text: Such an amazing song. It's a shame we had to wait for the end of the game to get the best track.
author: salozmen29

text: Sweet piano work
author: Guyal Sfere

text: I'm always pleasantly surprised when an Alundra song pops up for some reason. One of my favourite games ever :).
author: greenyxi

text: I was proud of my fortitude in clearing this game sans-guide. This dungeon was torturous for poor ole' me. Awesome atmosphere, and an even better plot. Thank you Working Designs. They also gave us the wonderful Lunar with that great translation job.
author: Karlos B.

text: One of my all time favorites games.
author: Aiath86

text: This song is beautiful
author: RichChanLikesTacos

text: Damn, that nostalgic feel again.... Thanks :')
author: Thelos Verlos

text: Love that game. One of the most interesting Zelda clones, in my opinion. The story is surprisingly bleak and the music/pixel art/gameplay come together to form something really special. My only issue with it has always been the puzzles, as some of them pretty much require a guide (or ample patience) to get through.
author: NeonCrusader

text: By far my favourite soundtrack from Kohei Tanaka :) Kline's Dream, Ra's Underground Hideout...
author: SOLaharl

text: A think Alundra vgm 43 was one of the first songs on the list I came across... been almost 8 years already.
author: Sephiko

text: @Sephiko Pretty crazy when you think about it. Almost a decade.
author: SupraDarky

text: @Sephiko  UNH
author: xavier

text: @SupraDarky it IS...
author: CleverDjembe

text: @Sephiko It really is something when you go back at some of the older vids on his list and read SupraDarky's comments. His comments are much more mature now, and I think similar things can be said for many of us.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: I've heard that this game is difficult. Is that true? Good track btw.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: @GoRedskinsAndWizards  I remember the puzzles giving me trouble when I was younger but after replaying it recently they weren't nearly as hard as I found them previously,still harder than most "puzzles" found in modern titles. Bosses will smack the hell out of you sometimes that's the truth
author: Asuka0242

text: @GoRedskinsAndWizards I'd say it's harder than any Zelda game out there... except for the fact you can get the strongest weapon extremely early in the game if you wanted to, doesn't require any skill to get it either. It kinda spoils the difficulty.
author: Question Mark

text: @Fée Is it harder than the NES Zeldas?
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: @GoRedskinsAndWizards much. This is what zelda should be like if they bothered with a hard mode
author: maverickmic

text: @maverickmic Whoa.....really? Much harder than Zelda 2? That's saying a lot....
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: @GoRedskinsAndWizards I've not played that one but there's few games that compare to the 8 bit eras difficulty!
author: maverickmic

text: This is one of my favorite games on the PS1 and easily one of my favorite "Zelda clones". Great atmosphere and puzzles with a quite unique soundtrack. It took me until 2 years ago to finally give Alundra 2 a shot and I actually found myself really enjoying it as well on its own. As a sequel to this game though, I can understand how most people were disappointed. I'd love to get a new Alundra, but that's probably not happening.
author: SupraDarky

text: @SupraDarky It's a gem, but I don't think it needs a sequel. Wouldn't mind the same team getting the chance to make another game, but Alundra is beautiful all on its own. As long as it keeps being accessible to future generations, we're good.
author: Lung kisser

text: @SupraDarky Kickstarter away!
author: electricmastro

text:
@*****
You should consider it. You should also consider playing Landstalker: The Treasures of King Nole.
author: electricmastro

text: @SupraDarky What a coincidence! I just started playing Alundra yesterday! (Today actually, yesterday I just tested)
author: Claudio Marcelo Basckeira

text: @Claudio Marcelo Basckeira Opa, um BR por aqui! Cara, eu escuto essa música quase todo dia mesmo que seja só na minha cabeça. Alundra é um dos poucos games "Zelda clones" que realmente estão à altura de Zelda, seja pelo gameplay ou pela trilha sonora magnifica. Pô, ouvindo essa trilha outra vez bateu o sentimento nostalgico de jogar dinovo. XD
author: Thelos Verlos

text:
@SupraDarky Alundra was an awesome experience on every level. This game was not made  for making you happy because on every step, something happens which makes you sad.  Even for todays standards, it was a brutal what happens ingame :/.

As for Alundra 2, it was different. It felt like an ordinary adventure. It was fun, sure. But somehow I was dissapointed
author: Patzerli
